page.title: 08CHURCHES
page.content: THERE ARE THREE CHURCHES IN THE VILLAGES OF KENN AND KENNFORD. THE EARLIEST ONE,ST ANDREWS IN KENN DATES FROM THE 14TH CENTURY AND WHOSE MEMBERS BELONG TO THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND.MEMBERS OF THE METHODIST CHURCH HAVE A SMALL CHAPEL IN KENNFORD AS DOES ANOTHER NON CONFORMIST CHURCH. ST ANDREWS HAS A FINE ROOD WITH FIGURES CARVED IN OBERAMERGAU IN 1889,THESE FIGURES BEING ADDED AT THAT TIME. THE SCREEN HAS PAINTINGS OF THE SAINTS IN ITS LOWER PANELS. THE NON CONFORMIST CHAPELS ARE MUCH PLAINER IN THEIR DESIGNS. THESE CONTRAST WITH ST ANDREWS WHICH IS CONSIDERED HIGH CHURCH WHILST THEY ARE LOW CHURCH.THE FOLLOWING OF CHRIST IS ON THE INCREASE WITH PEOPLE FREE TO ATTEND THE PLACE OF WORSHIP OF THEIR CHOICE.
